schemes.ObjectOfIssue:
The Company proposes to utilize the funds which are being raised through this Issue (“Net Proceeds”) towards the following object:

  1. Funding working capital requirements of the Company;
  2. Funding of capital expenditure requirements of the company towards the purchase of machinery and equipment;
  3. Repayment or prepayment, in whole or in part, of all or a portion of certain outstanding borrowings availed by the company, from banks and financial institutions;
  4. General corporate purposes; and
  5. Issue Expenses

schemes.companyDescription:
Incorporated in 1984, Innomet Advanced Materials Limited specializes in the manufacturing of metal powders and tungsten heavy alloys.

The company operates two divisions:

- Innomet Powders

- Innotung

Innomet adheres to ISO 9001:2015 standards for the manufacturing and supply of ferrous and non-ferrous metal/alloy powders and tungsten heavy alloy components.

Their product range includes over 20 types of powders, such as copper, bronze, brass, nickel, tin, and stainless steel, catering to various industries. They also specialize in custom grades of metal and alloy powders containing iron, copper, nickel, tin, zinc, and cobalt.

Innomet supplies products both domestically and internationally, with clients in the US, UK, Germany, Netherlands, Japan, Italy, New Zealand, Lebanon, and Brunei.

As of March 31, 2024, the company employs 56 people across various departments.
